text:
Hi there!
A new error is preventing me from uploading `fields.json` files to newly created modules. I’ve tried a myriad of solutions, including updating to the latest CLI, permanently deleting the module both locally and remotely, and several other attempts. However, I’m still getting the same "module ID duplication" error for the module I deleted 24 hours ago. I never ran into such an error before.

Is there a local or remote cache I need to clear? If so, where is it located?

I really appreciate the help! Thanks!

*Error:*
 `HubSpotHttpError: The post in account xxxxxxx was bad. Another custom widget with ID xxxxxx already exists with the label aTestSidebarBanner in folder with ID xxxxxxx in portal xxxxxxx`

hi there. I am attempting to set up a new theme using projects and I have followed the instructions <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/guides/cms/content/themes/build-and-deploy-with-projects|here>. the next step after fetching the theme is building the project using hs project upload. when i do so I get a build failure with 70 errors, the first of which are

```This portal does not have access to content scaffolding```
Hi <@U018R45DZRQ> send me this issue let me check
